I only sleep hour stints, last week I was up for 4 days straight. Everything bothers me, my place is trashed from not doing crap for months, I worry that I won't get better and need to get a new job.

It's day 3 off of a 8 day relapse. Came clean to everyone I know (all very supportive) Been a closet oxy user for years... had some good clean time before lapsing the last 8 days prior to Saturday.
Dropping the Lope to 6mg today, plan on working out after work, dropping the Benzo to .25mg today and .75mg tonight before bed.
Yesterday was decent... finished the day with 6mg lope, .25 kpin and 1 Gabapentin before bed.
Sleep was total shit and so is this morning.
Still have the morning GI lingering around but the malaise is still the biggest pain in the ass.

I still cry like a baby sometimes but less frequently... I'm still anxious as fuck for parts of the day but I find my body TRYING to relax in the evening. I still don't feel like dealing with the outside world after work but I'm entertaining the idea of old interests.

This shit isn't easy... but that shouldn't be the reason you don't stop using. It's not supposed to be easy, you're trying to rescue your hijacked brain and body from something that's held it hostage for however long.
Weird - I don't want to use BAD here because things are improving from all angles, I also don't want to make it seem like a rose garden. So... I'm still having gnarly morning GI that tapers off.

it hit me like a fuckin sack of bricks... started pouring sweat, plotting and rationalizing all the ways I could get around this security blanket that I've created, giving myself reasons as to why it would be okay,
Yesterday went pretty well other than a few cases of the clammy sweats.
Yesterday was okay minus a crazy afternoon episode of the sweats. I fuckin hate that feeling. Lingering symptoms are still morning GI/Restless when I try to relax/anxiety sweats.
Symptoms at 3 weeks out... broken sleep of 4-6 hours, morning shits (a very zen one this morning at least), anhedonia waves, come and go restless limbs.
Sunday morning the fog rolled back in. Emotional, tons of GI issues, anxiety sweats, depressed, stir crazy, irritable, restless. Felt like day 4 of withdrawals out of the blue.
Only things lingering around at 25 days are morning GI, restless sleep, anxiety/anhedonia waves.
This was the day of the month I would get my script refilled and normally start the process of one GREAT week followed by the cycle of withdrawal etc etc.
My body/brain are feeling anxious, depressed and just out of sync compared to 27-30. Almost feels like days 7-11 again.
I feel so much better than I thought I would. I have an appetite.

The memory fades as time goes by. I doubt the memories will ever disappear completely, but I liken it to the memories of an ex-girlfriend. They are romantic memories, and when we think about them, we always conveniently fail to also remember the horrible things that we hated about the relationship.

How will that end. The best case scenario is that you don’t OD, in which case you would just be using, getting sick, spending all of your money, always worrying, and surrounded by people who similarly only care about themselves- not because they are inherently bad people- but because they too are a slave to their own addiction.

So I just started my suboxone after a 6 months binge, and I'm honestly suprised it kept me outta WDs. The one thing I have noticed are some of the side effects.

Luckily I've only been using everyday for about 3 weeks, but fuck. I'm 24 hours into withdraw and it's tough. I have to say I don't feel as bad, physically, as I did when coming off oxy. But my state of mind is in the trash.
This is my first sober weekend so I'm staying busy. ... This is my first time taking the total abstinence path, so I felt isolated but met some really cool guys at the meeting and got some numbers.
Today is day 13 for me! This is the longest I've been sober since summer 2011, and first time I'm really sober.
I haven't been sick in years, at least I haven't felt sick, other than withdrawals, in years.

I'm grateful that this 23 time has seemed to be the charm. I'm grateful I was finally able to make it past the first week, the first month to get to the point where the haze began to clear and I was able to start seeing that I really could have a better life.
I was talking about you guys and recommended a new comer come check this sub out. ... Opiates brought me to the brink of destruction, and I truly thought my addiction was going to kill me.
I'm too high to really explain shit
I still fantasize about doing dope constantly. And dream about scoring, or remembering a misplaced gram in my room every night.
Now after quitting H for almost 2 years it's like I've aged 10 years.
While I am currently keeping withdrawals at bay with 10 - 20mg a day of OC (I was pretty steady at 50 - 100mg a day, every day),
I take one, and I feel no more WD, and I take another - now, I want to play some CS:GO. In fact, I feel better than I normally do on fent.
I had my last oxy yesterday morning -- then I had about 1mg of sub last night, and I'm 100% dry
I'm so tired of constantly dealing with moderate to severe withdrawals. Even on a sunny day, I'm shivering, and my nose is draining.

After 90 hours since my last oxycodone dose, I can officially say that I am withdrawal free (with minor exception).
I've had to call on my clean friends and therapist every single day for the past week. Hanging on for dear life here.

It's the middle of November and it's 15 degrees Celsius outside right now (60 degrees in American), it's gorgeous but I just feel like I want to grab all of a sudden. Lot harder to shake today than yesterday.
I smoked a roach I had in my ash tray on Friday night and felt immense relief from the nasty cravings I was/am getting for my DOC.
Slept the first 12 hours. Unable to keep any food or even water down.

Even now, on day 6 and just barely through the worst of the physical symptoms, my desire to use is still there. My desire to stay clean is also still there and this is why I'm posting about it and why I've been on the phone all morning.
I just hit 96 hours into my current detox. Feeling a little more human.

I'm barely 100 hours into my detox but I'm just thinking about last Wednesday around noon, three hours after my last dose, negative 800 in my account, no credit, nothing to my name anymore. The desperation. The insanity. The panic.
Not exactly looking forward to it but looking forward to the business of getting my shit together and perhaps finally working at some of my root issues.
I'm an addict in early recovery (Feb. 22), I'm tripping balls.
Not gonna do it but not breathing anymore seems like a very enticing prospect right now.

After trying NA and all that and never making 60 days of being clean, I was in the suboxin program multiple times. I had finally made it, I thought, had a job, a car, was selling OxyContin in 09 and taking subs, had money,women, dope was never sick and after spending 5 hours trying to find a vein one day I just had enough and stopped.
I have been homeless have boosted and done various other things for a daily fix. Detox 7 times, impatient numerous times...etc etc.

We started using together and he was shocked when he had the same shit happening to him. We were hanging out and smoking with our friend one day and brought this up to him and he was like damn guys, you're kicking!

I've been without heroin for a little bit now, I've had my ups and downs, and it has seemed a lot easier this time around. Sometimes I just think the reality of the situation hasn't hit me yet and I'll be hit in the face with all the problems I've been numbing away all these years.
I'm withdrawing and will be up aaall night. Someone said withdrawing is paying back all the happiness/good feelings you had while you were high lol.

I swear the withdrawals are just as bad if not worse than last time I detoxed even though I was doing significantly less, diff ROA and shorter time period. I'm almost 24 hours in and miserable.
Headed into day 4 now of withdrawal from bth. Far from my first rodeo but I'm at the breaking point. I'm just trying to not let myself leave the house right now. Minute by minute.
this morning was the worst so far. Haven't slept still at all, just absolutely miserable and losing my mind.

I was basically sitting on my hands watching the clock minute by minute telling myself not to leave the house. I knew if I left I'd get dope. I was just so miserable, so depressed, complete anhedonia, couldn't even watch a fucking TV show. Nothing could hold my attention and I felt crushing sadness and hopelessness.

These 6 months of recovery have been fucking amazing!! I started at the very bottom at a sales job, and have worked my way close to the top. Just got promoted to sales manager last week! I'm making great money, and will be in the market for my own little condo by summer.

me and my girl plan to withdraw from a half gram a day habit of heroin over the weekend. we're seasoned veterans with painkillers (oxys, hydros, fentanyl, codiene, morphine, you name it) and have been doing some real ass #4 china daily/all day for about 2 weeks now.

i'm expecting to be ready to die in about eight hours, but i've also been told by fellow addicts more seasoned in heroin use (i'm an oxy guy. been doing oxy off and on for 6 years and i come from a place with no herron. now i live where there's hella dope, first time using H was last year though) that the withdrawal in comparison to oxy isnt as long or strong.
does anyone with experience on heroin withdrawal know how much longer my body will feel like hell?
if i hypothetically smoked a tiny bit of heroin. like a quarter gram between two people, would the wd's come full force, or just based on the amount of usage if i didnt use again after that?

whats the bioavailability like for smoking these bad boys? i like smoking them because they taste good and you get the rush you initially get smoking dope, but if i can make it stretch longer by doing 10-15mg lines and beating the time release i'd do that.
I could lowkey dose in the bathroom/green room (if the venue has one?) after my set and enjoy some good bands, but I may hold off a bit longer so my W/D experience isnt as bad.

I got one to help cope with withdrawal and chip off Heroin, because for some reason I don't feel a craving for Oxy like I do with Heroin and as long as I do a tiny bit of opiate I can usually endure any remaining w/d symptoms.

I was taking 8mg clonazepam for 2 full years daily (RX'd) and probably 80-100mg oxycodone a day and cut both cold turkey once. Thats what's been keeping me through this withdrawal! I havent even had much cravings during my acute's

Right now I'm on day 2 of fentanyl/analog withdrawal. Surprisingly not as bad as I thought. I was smoking about .25 of buffed heroin/fent/fent analog daily, and I haven't even got the crazy rib pains, or really anything besides lethargy/sweats/cold chills.
Whenever one of us needs to get sober, despite the pain, the other is always right there.
